title: What is the significance of mystical numbers in Christianity and how did authors like Boezio influence Dante's beliefs?
first_phrase: In the preceding text, we learn that many influential thinkers before Dante, including Pythagoras and Severino Boezio, saw mystical significance in numbers. Boezio sought to reconcile the two philosophies of Aristotelian scholasticism and Pythagorean mysticism, emphasizing the intrinsic harmony and divine essence of numbers. His treatise on music specifically reflects Pythagorean principles. This Catholic numerology persisted after Boezio, with later figures like San Bernardino and P. Atanasio Kircher also assigning mystical significance to numbers.
